source: PubMed Five Years Cholera Surveillance Ivory Coast 2001-2005
processing_notes: Source states: 'As of 21 September, 3152 cases, including 175 deaths have been reported between May and September in the entire country' - interpreted as sCh cases with CFR calculated

source: PubMed Five Years Cholera Surveillance Ivory Coast 2001-2005
processing_notes: Source states: '2012 cases, including 51 deaths have been reported in Abidjan' - interpreted as sCh cases with CFR calculated

source: WHO Disease Outbreak News 2002 Cholera Côte d'Ivoire
processing_notes: Source states: 'As of 14 July 2002 the Ministry of Health has reported a total of 581 cases with 19 deaths (case-fatality rate of 3.27%) since the beginning of the year' - interpreted as sCh cases
Source states: 'cholera broke out in the Abidjan neighborhood of Adjamé, with 35 confirmed cases resulting in 7 deaths, representing a fatality rate of 20 percent' - interpreted as sCh cases

Source states: 'In October 2014 (week 41), a cholera epidemic was declared in Abidjan... A total of 264 cases were reported with 19 deaths, representing a case fatality rate of 7.2%' - interpreted as sCh cases across 8 health districts

source: Côte d'Ivoire Ministry of Health Press Release 2025
processing_notes: Source states: 'A total of 45 cases have been recorded in Vridi Akobrate, in the suburbs of Abidjan, including seven deaths' - interpreted as sCh cases with CFR calculated
Source confirms: 'Côte d'Ivoire does not appear among the 14 African countries that reported cholera outbreaks to WHO in 2024' - validated zero transmission period
Source confirms: WHO surveillance data through May 2025 shows CIV absent from cholera reporting countries prior to May 25 outbreak - validated zero transmission period
Source states: 'A cholera outbreak which started in September 1995 caused 2,027 cases and 150 deaths up to 12 November 1995' - interpreted as sCh cases with CFR calculated

source: Community-Based Surveillance Côte d'Ivoire Guinea Border 2016
processing_notes: Source states: 'A total of 3,734 signals of priority diseases and 4,918 unusual health events were reported' from community-based surveillance in 3 Guinea border districts - interpreted as surveillance capacity data

source: IPCI 2012 Cholera Mission Report Water Sampling Study
processing_notes: Source states: 'In total, 362 water samples were taken between February and March 2012 from wells, lagoons and wastewater' with Vibrio cholerae isolation confirmed in Abidjan waters - interpreted as environmental surveillance samples with cholera contamination detection

source: Abidjan Informal Settlements Cross-Sectional WASH Access Survey 2021-2022
processing_notes: Source states: 'A comparative cross-sectional study was conducted between July 2021 and February 2022, including 1714 households in two informal settlements in Abidjan' - interpreted as survey sample size for health access assessment

source: Vibrio Contamination Risk Assessment Coastal Towns Côte d'Ivoire Crustacean Consumption Study
processing_notes: Source states: 'Vibrio spp. were isolated from 7.8% of crustacean samples studied' and '11.7% reported daily consumption of crustaceans' with '7.5% reported symptoms of food poisoning' - interpreted as surveillance data for Vibrio exposure risk assessment
